Some suggestions for functions to be implemented,
however these depend completely on your game idea

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;
div.div:
INDEX.HTML
Load all javascript libraries. Order matters!
External libraries:
jQuery 2.1.1-min.js
The game:
boilerplateGame.js
init.js (load last, always)

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

div.div: The game

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

div.div: startGame():
Start the game with desired configuration
- how to save answers (sendAnswer -function)
- how to indicate ended game (submit -function)

div.div:
boilerplateGame.js
Load first, so it's ready for initializing

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;
div.div:
Make some variables more available
self.data = self.options.data

switch.text:
Make some variables more available
self.data = self.options.data

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;
div.div:
Create div for game area
and append it to body or any other container defined in options.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;
div.div:
call
self.loadCss()
which loads all
necessary styles (base_theme.css)
If you need any CSS-libraries, add them
to loadCss

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;
div.div:
Call
self.resize and add
the resize-function
to window.onresize event, to resize game
world if the user resizes the
browser window

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;
div.div:
Call
self.drawStartScreen()
"loading screen" with a start button
A screen that stops the game from starting
on its own.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

div.div: - Add a button
- Add a click listener to button to start the game
- Add a keylistener (enter) to start the game. Also
remove the listener when button is clicked.
- Some CSS-animation hacking
- Do any preloading you want in here.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

div.div: The game stars there. Do what you want :)

switch.text:
start()
The game stars there. Do what you want :)

div.div: - What heppens on correct answer

div.div: - Draw the initial state of lifes

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

div.div: - Update the state of lifes after wrong answer

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;
div.div:
OPTIONS
parent: where to create the game
url: where to look for imgs and sounds
submit: submit -function
sendAnswer: save answer
data: game settings (questions etc)
theme: which theme to use
Optional settings
lifes: how many lifes
nOfOptions: how many options should
be visible at once (MCQ-style)
Add what you need

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

div.div: Init boilerplateGame.js with all the options

div.span: Load basic css theme base_theme.css and all
other CSS-files needed. You might want
to load for example animate.css in here or

div.span: Draw all the elements that need to be shown
to the player and are not dynamically
